intro: Minuartia lydia, commonly known as the Lydian rock-cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, mat-forming perennial that typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers with four petals, often arranged in clusters. Its leaves are linear and closely spaced, adapted to minimize water loss in arid environments. Minuartia lydia is known for its resilience and is often found in alpine or coastal regions.
